column2: The once magnificent Tang dynasty has fallen, China is in turmoil... The Celestial Empire will be able to rise again, driven by a new and brilliant dynasty? Or will follow the same sad fate of fragmentations of the West? Meanwhile, in the troubled Europe, the Carolingian dynasty ceased to reign, and new dynasties arise, what will be their fate?

The School of Law or Legalism doctrine was formulated by Li Kui, Shang Yang (d. 338 BC), Han Feizi (d. 233 BC), and Li Si (d. 208 BC), who maintained that human nature was incorrigibly selfish, accordingly, the only way to preserve the social order was to impose discipline from above, and to see to a strict enforcement of laws. The Legalists exalted the state above all, seeking its prosperity and martial prowess over the welfare of the common people. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! No religious head
§Y*§! All the chinese states can subjugate other chinese rulers freely
§Y*§! The Chinese rulers have a special casus belli "imperial reconquest" on each territory of the de jure empire of China.

Mohism was developed by followers of Mozi (also referred to as Mo Di, 470–c.391 BC). Mohism was seen as a major rival of Confucianism in the period of the Hundred Schools of Thought. Its philosophy rested on the idea of universal love: Mozi believed that "everyone is equal before heaven", and that people should seek to imitate heaven by engaging in the practice of collective love. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! No religious head
§Y*§! All the chinese states can subjugate other chinese rulers freely
§Y*§! Pacifist religion, no kind of holy war available
§Y*§! The Chinese rulers have a special casus belli "imperial reconquest" on each territory of the de jure empire of China.

Neo-Confucianism was an attempt to create a more rationalist and secular form of Confucianism by rejecting superstitious and mystical elements of Daoism and Buddhism that had influenced Confucianism during and after the Han Dynasty. Although the Neo-Confucianists were critical of Daoism and Buddhism, the two did have a great influence on the philosophy, and the Neo-Confucianists borrowed terms and concepts from both. However, unlike the Buddhists and Daoists, who saw metaphysics as a catalyst for spiritual development, religious enlightenment, and immortality, the Neo-Confucianists used metaphysics as a guide for developing a rationalist ethical philosophy. Neo-Confucianism can be the new confucian orthodoxy of the Chinese Empire. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! No religious head
§Y*§! All the chinese states can subjugate other chinese rulers freely
§Y*§! Pacifist religion, no kind of holy war available
§Y*§! The Chinese rulers have a special casus belli "imperial reconquest" on each territory of the de jure empire of China.

Confucianism is an ethical and philosophical system, on occasion described as a religion, developed from the teachings of the Chinese philosopher Confucius. Confucianism originated as an "ethical-sociopolitical teaching" during the Spring and Autumn Period, but later developed metaphysical and cosmological elements in the Han Dynasty. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! No religious head
§Y*§! All the chinese states can subjugate other chinese rulers freely
§Y*§! Pacifist religion, no kind of holy war available
§Y*§! The Chinese rulers have a special casus belli "imperial reconquest" on each territory of the de jure empire of China.

Taoism, or Daoism, is a philosophical, ethical, and religious tradition of Chinese origin that emphasizes living in harmony with the Tao (also romanized as Dao). The term Tao means "way", "path" or "principle", Tao denotes something that is both the source and the driving force behind everything that exists. Institutionalized forms, however, evolved over time in the shape of a number of different schools. Taoist schools traditionally feature reverence for Laozi, immortals or ancestors, along with a variety of divination and exorcism rituals, and practices for achieving ecstasy, longevity or immortality. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! No religious head
§Y*§! All the chinese states can subjugate other chinese rulers freely
§Y*§! Pacifist religion, no kind of holy war available
§Y*§! The Chinese rulers have a special casus belli "imperial reconquest" on each territory of the de jure empire of China.

Austronesia is the vast oceanic region which stretches from Madagascar to Taiwan to New Zealand. Encompassing both scattered archipelagos and major landmasses, Austronesia - derived from the Latin australis,'southern',and Greek nesos,'island' - is used primarily as a linguistic term, designating a family of languages spoken by peoples with a shared heritage. They developed a unified pattern of religion characterised by mortuary rites, headhunting and agrarian rituals of the annual calendar, culminating in a post-harvest festival often sexual in nature.

Austronesia is the vast oceanic region which stretches from Madagascar to Taiwan to New Zealand. Encompassing both scattered archipelagos and major landmasses, Austronesia - derived from the Latin australis,'southern',and Greek nesos,'island' - is used primarily as a linguistic term, designating a family of languages spoken by peoples with a shared heritage. They developed a unified pattern of religion characterised by mortuary rites, headhunting and agrarian rituals of the annual calendar, culminating in a post-harvest festival often sexual in nature. Now the austronesian religion is re-organized in a church.

Mandaeism s a gnostic religion, (Aramaic manda means "knowledge," as does Greek gnosis) with a strongly dualistic worldview. Its adherents, the Mandaeans, revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enosh, Noah, Shem, Aram and especially John the Baptist, but reject Abraham, Moses and Jesus of Nazareth. According to most scholars, Mandaeans migrated from the Southern Levant to Mesopotamia in the first centuries CE, and are of pre-Arab and pre-Islamic origin. They are Semites and speak a dialect of Eastern Aramaic known as Mandaic. They may well be related to the "Nabateans of Iraq" who were pagan, Aramaic-speaking indigenous pre-Arab and pre-Islamic inhabitants of southern Iraq.

Kaharingan, is a folk religion professed in Borneo. The word Kaharingan means life, and this belief system includes a concept of a supreme deity—although this may be the result of the need to conform to the idea of "One Supreme God" (Ketuhanan yang Maha Esa), Hindu-Javanese influence can be seen in this religion, and many people views it as a form of Hinduism. The main festival of Kaharingan is the Tiwah festival, which lasts for thirty days, and involves the sacrifice many animals like buffaloes, cows, pigs, and chickens as offerings to the Supreme God.

The Chinese folk religion or Chinese traditional religion, is the collection of grassroots ethnic religious traditions of the Han Chinese, or the indigenous religion of China. Chinese folk religion primarily consists in the worship of the shen ( "gods", "spirits", "awarenesses", "consciousnesses", "archetypes", literally "expressions", the energies that generate things and make them thrive) which can be nature deities, city deities or tutelary deities of other human agglomerations, national deities, cultural heroes and demigods, ancestors and progenitors, deities of the kinship. Holy narratives regarding some of these gods are codified into the body of Chinese mythology. Another name of this complex of religions is Chinese Universism, especially referring to its intrinsic metaphysical perspective.

Korean shamanism, also known as Muism  is the ethnic religion of Korea and the Koreans. Muism goes back to pre-historic times, thus it pre-dates the introduction of Buddhism and Confucianism, and the influence of Taoism, in Korea. Central to the faith is the belief in Haneullim or Hwanin, meaning "source of all being" and of all gods of nature, the utmost god or the supreme mind.

Vietnamese folk religion or Vietnamese indigenous religion also called Thanism is the ethnic religion of the Vietnamese people, The Vietnamese folk religion shows a great quantity of similarities with southern Chinese folk religion. Vietnamese folk religion is not an organized religious system, but a set of local worship traditions devoted to the than, a term which can be translated as "spirits", "gods" or with the more exhaustive locution "generative powers". These gods can be nature deities, or national, community or kinship tutelary deities or ancestral gods, and the ancestral gods of a specific family. Ancestry gods are often deified heroic persons. Vietnamese mythology preserves narratives telling of the action of many of the cosmic gods and cultural heroes.

The purity is used as a synonym for chastity and piety in an individual, a man with greater purity is a man who lives on the path of Light. A man considered pure will have the appreciation of his head of religion and his most religious vassals.
The book of the Great Treasure

The Yazidi are mostly Kurdish-speaking people who adhere to a branch of Iranian religions that blends elements of Mithraism, pre-Islamic Mesopotamian/Assyrian religious traditions, Christianity and Islam. Their faith is extremely old, but only in the 12th century Islamic Sufi doctrine Introduced to the area by Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir and was merged to their worship. Yazidis believe that God created the world and left seven angels in charge, the chief of whom is the Peacock Angel, Malek Taus or Shaytan, a being usually identified by Christians and Muslims as Satan. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! The Yazidi Sheikhdom is held by a secular ruler, and can cease to exist.
§Y*§! The Yazidi Sheikh can subjugate other Yazidi rulers freely
§Y*§! The Yazidi Sheikh can declare great holy war
§Y*§! Yazidi rulers can - and are expected to have - multiple wives
§Y*§! Temple Holdings can be held by anyone without penalty
§Y*§! Rulers can marry close kin to improve vassal opinion

Manichaeism is a Gnostic religion founded by the alleged prophet Mani who was put to death by the Sassanid Shahanshah Bahram I in 277. His 'Religion of Light' incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. \n§Y*§! Can search illumination \n§Y*§! Rulers can declare Holy Wars

The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials, generally built along an east-to-west line across the historical northern borders of China in part to protect the Chinese Empire or its prototypical states against intrusions by various nomadic groups or military incursions by various warlike peoples or forces. repair this barrier will provide a great deal of prestige to a ruler, but it is also a huge expense. In any case, the nature of the Great Wall makes it fragile, and other repairs will be needed in the future.

Support the neo-Confucian thought would put an end to religious problems in the empire: the neo-Confucian thought syncretizes elements of Taoism, Confucianism and Buddhism, according to the slogan "The three masters are one!", in this way the empire will get again religious unity, lost since the time of the Han Dynasty.
Taoism is a very interesting school of thinking. why do not you be introduced to its mysteries and teachings?
Confucianism is the path that every Chinese should follow! I should immediately start doing it, my ancestors and the heavenly Emperor would be proud of me.
Buddhism is an ancient religion that comes from distant India. It would be right to follow the path of Buddha and groped to reach enlightenment?
Eunuchs were very important for any eastern ruler, and many families castrate their children specifically in hopes of finding a better future for them. Why do not start to looking for one of them?
Starting a pilgrimage was considered an act of great piety by any Manichean.

The bema is the most important festival for the Manicheans. After a long time of fasting, having celebrated with songs and prayers the ascension of the light particle of Mani, now is the time to go to confession all together, and celebrate with music and ritual gestures.
Losar is the Tibetan word for "new year". "lo" holds the semantic field "year, age"
column3: "sar" holds the semantic field "new, fresh". Losar is the most important holiday in all the tibetan cultures.

column2: The Tangut people is now powerful  enough to require official recognition as a sovereign state.
Is time to restore the unity of the Tianxia.
The jurchen people is now powerful  enough to require official recognition as a sovereign state.

We are the current rulers of the ancient and mysterious steppes of Inner Mongolia. It is said that this place is inhabited by gods, the worst of the demons, spirits ... wild beasts, and one of the strongest people of the earth. We had been warned to not challenge the rough climate and the fierce tribes of the region, it seems that now, driven northward because of our expansion, a powerful Khan has brought together the various tribes, and is preparing to take back the lands of his ancestors...

The land of the mongols is now in the rightful hands... the great horde goes so slowly dispersing, the various chiefs and the tribes, they return to occupy their space, their pastures, their immense plains, the peaks of their mountains, their deserts ... Could this be a warning, no one can subdue the land of Mongolia.
The work at Great Wall began. Many are sent to the border, this large use of manpower is an additional expense for our empire. To complete the work will require at least ten years.
Make it better has ever been!
The Great Wall was finally repaired! anyone can admire this magnificent work. The barbarous nations will bow down before the greatness of the emperor.

Now that the Neo-Confucian thought is supported by the state as the official doctrine of the Celestial Empire, many thinkers emerge in every part of the Tianxia, and spread their ideas by printing codes and volumes of philosophy. The empire finally can live an era of peace and stability.
Now we are recognized for all purposes as a powerful and rich sovereign state ... but the rise has only just begun.
Now we are recognized for all purposes as a powerful and rich sovereign state ... but the rise has only just begun.
All our efforts must focus on this

A dark age is over, the Heavenly Empire has risen again, under a new and powerful dynasty, and is now ready to accompany all the peoples of the four corners of the world into a new era of peace, prosperity and justice.
Some eunuchs approaches your court, willing to offer their services. It's the time to submit their to the keju, the examination for the selection of the most valid elements.
The prophet Mani was a great traveler, why do not imitate his example? it's time to go on a pilgrimage to visit one of the places blessed by the presence of one of the messengers of the Light.
I will go to Babylon, place of the life of the Prophet Mani.
I will start making travel plans.
column3: Je vais commencer à préparer mon voyage.
column4: Ich bereite jetzt meine Reisepläne vor

column2: You have finally arrived at Babylon! But wait! This is Babylon? The locals call it Baghdad, but christians that I met during the trip, they said that it is, and can not be otherwise, the city is huge, and here lies the great Yamag. Breathing the air of thousands of years of history, the same air breathed by the prophet Mani. Is wonderful.
I shall go on a pilgrimage to seek God's grace at one of the holy places of the world.
column3: Je doit accomplir un pèlerinage et chercher la grâce de Dieu dans un des lieux saints du christianisme.
column4: Ich begebe mich auf Pilgerfahrt, um Gottes Gnade an einer der heiligen Stätten der Christenheit zu suchen.
column6: Iré de peregrinación en busca de la gracia de Dios a uno de los lugares santos del cristianismo.

column2: Pure Land, the path of Amitabha Buddha.

During a battle, a low-ranking military commander was noted for his skills from an army general, now the general clamoring for the promotion of this soldier. This will increase the number of available generals of the kingdom, this will be an expensive option, on the other hand, a refusal would guarantee a bad reputation in the army ...
For the ancestors, Give him a rank!
I do not want another general for another war.

One Yaoguai, a terrible demon, must have visited my dreams! I just woke up from a terrible nightmare, and it must be an omen. Perhaps it is a sign that the heaven is going to remove the divine mandate of my dynasty?
Perhaps a wizard can help me...

Wandering around in the streets of district of the temple, has not been at all difficult to find characters who practice the occult taoist arts of astrology and magic. I approach the priest, he can help me, I should ask him a prediction?
I do not dare. The fate must remain a secret ...
I'm here, and I will never know the meaning of what I saw. I am obsessed by the thought that my dynasty is going to fall at any moment.
Everything is useless, the heavens have spoken.

After performing the necessary rites, the priest continues in the prediction. Apparently, interpreting the stars, signs, and my dream, everything leads to think that it is a good presage! It seems that will I get glory and honor.
I have to be sure of this!
The astronomer performs the rituals, almost shaking, and he reveals that what he saw was a terrible presage, my future is really dark?
The rites take place. Looking at the stars, the wizard tells me that there is nothing to worry aboutapparently there is no change in my future.

Confucius say: Ignorance is the night of the mind, but a night without moon or stars. If you do not know something, does not make sense to wriggle away in the darkness, rather make your life better with actions. This says the priest.

The Liao dynasty has fallen. After dominating the north of China for over a hundred years, has now been destroyed by a great jurchen rebellion, and now all that remains of the people of Khitai, is fleeing to the west, following the charismatic commander Dashi. is the dawn of a new empire? Or is it just a temporary truce, and the big Liao Dynasty will return to the East, to permanently destroy the jurchen, and ending the Jin dynasty once and for all?
The Chán/Zen tradition is the most common Buddhist practice of east asia
Pure Land buddhism, also referred to as Amidism, is an east asian tradition of Buddhist teachings that are focused on Amitabha Buddha.
This man has been reduced to slavery. The owner may dispose of him as he wishes, he is now his property.
This man is a slave trader. He does not care anything about your tender heart. He wants to do business, now.
This man has owned or owns slaves.

Serfdom was a condition of bondage, is not slavery, it is rather a condition typical of feudal societies. The servant, however, is a "non-free" man, and the owner may dispose of him as he wishes, according to precise laws that protect, however, the condition of the servant.
This man is known as a liberator of slaves.

column2: [This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted man, is trying to learn to reject the poison that hate and anger brings to the mind.
column3: [This.GetTitledFirstName], bouddhiste zélé, tente d'apprendre à rejeter la haine et la colère qui sont des poisons de l'esprit.
column4: [This.GetTitledFirstName] ist überzeugter Buddhist und versucht, die Vergiftung des Geistes durch Hass und Zorn abzulehnen.
column6: [This.GetTitledFirstName], como budista devoto/a, trata de aprender a rechazar el veneno que el odio y la ira traen a la mente.

column2: [This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted man, is trying to learn to reject pride.
column3: [This.GetTitledFirstName], bouddhiste zélé, tente d'apprendre à rejeter l'orgueil.
column4: [This.GetTitledFirstName] ist überzeugter Buddhist und versucht, den Stolz abzulehnen.
column6: [This.GetTitledFirstName], como budista devoto/a, trata de aprender a rechazar el orgullo.

column2: [This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted man, is trying to learn to defeat [This.GetHerHis] fear of the world and of the designs of others.
column3: [This.GetTitledFirstName], bouddhiste zélé, tente d'apprendre à vaincre sa peur du monde et des projets d'autrui.
column4: [This.GetTitledFirstName] ist überzeugter Buddhist und versucht, [This.GetHerHis] Furcht vor der Welt und der Hinterhältigkeit anderer Menschen zu besiegen.
column6: [This.GetTitledFirstName], como budista devoto/a, trata de aprender a derrotar [This.GetHerHis] miedo al mundo y a los designios de otros.
